text: Oluwaseyi Abolaji (born May 6, 1983) is a former American soccer player. He and his brother, Oluwaseun Abolaji is the founder of Wilson's Juice Co, a lemonade juice company with a start-up of $10 in 2010 after his arrival to Nigeria. ==Career== Abolaji spent four years of his college career at Stanford University where he made a total of 51 appearances for the Cardinal. He also played professionally for California Cougars in the MISL and for Seattle Sounders in the USL First Division. ==References== ==External links== *Stanford University bio Category:1983 births Category:Living people Category:American soccer players Category:Stanford Cardinal men's soccer players Category:California Cougars players Category:Seattle Sounders (1994–2008) players Category:Association football defenders Category:Soccer players from Colorado Category:Major Indoor Soccer League (2001–2008) players Category:USL First Division players Category:Nigerian emigrants to the United States Category:People from Niger State Category:Sportspeople from Aurora, Colorado
title: Seyi Abolaji
